Now, coding all that step by step.

The full C implementation:

Start by writing the code skeleton.

#include <stdio.h>

int gcd(int a, int b) {
   while (b != 0) {
       int t = b;
       b = a % b;
       a = t;
   }
   return a;
}

int main() {
    int n, num;
    if (scanf("%d %d", &n, &num)!=2) {
        // handle error
        return 1;
    }

    // Read the numbers into an array
    int nums[num]; // variable length array (VLA). Work in C99.
    for (int i=0; i<num; i++) {
        if (scanf("%d", &nums[i]) !=1) return 1;
    }

    // Create unique array
    int unique_size =0;
    int unique[num]; // maximum possible unique elements is num
    for (int i=0; i<num; i++) {
        int current = nums[i];
        int found =0;
        for (int j=0; j<unique_size; j++) {
            if (unique[j]==current) {
                found=1;
                break;
            }
        }
        if (!found) {
            unique[unique_size++] = current;
        }
    }

    // Check exponents of 2 for each unique number
    int first_count =-1;
    for (int k=0; k<unique_size; k++) {
        int temp = unique[k];
        int count2 =0;
        while( temp %2 ==0 ) {
            temp /=2;
            count2++;
        }
        if (first_count ==-1) {
            first_count = count2;
        } else {
            if (count2 != first_count) {
                printf("0\n");
                return 0;
            }
        }
    }

    // Calculate LCM
    int lcm = unique[0];
    for (int i=1; i < unique_size; i++) {
        int curr = unique[i];
        int g = gcd(lcm, curr);
        lcm = (lcm /g)*curr;
    }

    // Compute the result
    int result = ( (num - lcm/2 ) / lcm ) +1;
    printf("%d\n", result);

    return 0;
}

Thus, reworking the full code with long long and proper GCD:

Now, recompose the full code:

#include <stdio.h>

long long gcd(long long a, long long b) {
    while (b != 0) {
        long long t = b;
        b = a % b;
        a = t;
    }
    return a;
}

int main() {
    int n, num;
    if (scanf("%d %d", &n, &num)!=2) {
        return 1;
    }

    int nums[num]; // Use VLA here. 
    for (int i=0; i < num; i++) {
        if (scanf("%d", &nums[i]) !=1 ) return 1;
    }

    int unique_size =0;
    int unique[num]; // since max unique elements are all num entries, but duplicates.
    for (int i=0; i < num; i++) {
        int current = nums[i];
        int found=0;
        for (int j=0; j < unique_size; j++) {
            if ( unique[j] == current ) {
                found = 1;
                break;
            }
        }
        if (!found) {
            unique[unique_size++] = current;
        }
    }

    // Check exponents for all unicue numbers
    int first_count =-1;
    for (int k=0; k < unique_size; k++) {
        int temp = unique[k];
        int count2 =0;
        while ( temp %2 ==0 ) {
            temp /=2;
            count2++;
        }
        if (first_count ==-1)
            first_count = count2;
        else {
            if ( count2 != first_count ) {
                printf("0\n");
                return 0;
            }
        }
    }

    // Compute LCM
    if ( unique_size ==0 ) { // impossible case, but handle?
        printf("0\n");
        return 0;
    }
    long long lcm = (long long) unique[0]; 
    for (int i =1; i < unique_size; i++) {
        long long curr = unique[i];
        long long g = gcd(lcm, curr);
        lcm = ( lcm / g ) * curr;
    }

    // Calculate the output result
    long long result = ( ( num - (lcm/2 )) / lcm ) +1;

    // Check if (num is smaller than lcm/2, but then result would be 0. 

    if (result < 0) {
        printf("0\n");
    } else {
        printf("%lld\n", result);
    }

    return 0;
}
